column4: Has anyone else had this weird behavior with usb external drive?  It gets "reset" then all the processes using it are blocked?
What type of drive is it?
Do you notice the drive spinning up and down when you try to access the drive with that program?
I was thinking it could be something with poor power management which is causing Ubuntu to unmount the drive which would cause the program lock issue
It might not be the drive, but the USB controller...
I was thinking the same thing
Are you using any USB hubs to connect the drives? Otherwise I would think you might want to get the extra controller

Something that occured to me.. I know that my USB controller has issues with large drives attached for booting and sometimes after the computer is running... It would be a very good idea to try a seperate controller card

no I don't use a hub direct connection.  Also not using it for booting I think I am going to try a pci usb controller just to rule to it out.  I've already done bios, kernel, all usb slots and tried drive in another ubuntu machine
you here?
Guess another thing to maybe try... Do you have a second computer?
Same version of Ubuntu?
Guess the newer kernel could be to blame.... not sure on that one
what is the motherboard make?
http://www.nationwidesurplus.com/p-5266-hp-proliant-ml350-g4-server-system-motherboard-390546-001.aspx
I'm stumpped... I'm really surprised that a new card wouldn't have solved the problem for you... Is it possible to boot live and test?
On board USB is 2.0 I take it?
yes
I'm seeing a ton of posts on the issue dating back a ways...
Yeah... sadly this isn't the first time I've seen issues with USB and motherboards.

did you get the link?  I wasn't paying attention and my bat died
I have a feeling that it's a driver issue at it's core... seems to be out for awhile but I'm not finding any submissions on bug trackers which concerns me
was there a particular reason that you were trying to use this externally?
